long_description: The Northwest Forest Pass grants access to entrance or day-use fee sites on national forests in Washington and Oregon for a single day. Valid at the following national forests: Columbia River Gorge, Colville, Deschutes, Fremont-Winema, Gifford Pinchot, Malheur, Mount Baker-Snoqualmie, Mount Hood, and Ochoco. Also includes the Okanogan and Wenatchee, Olympic, Rogue River-Siskiyou, Siuslaw, Umatilla, Umpqua, Wallowa-Whitman and Willamette. Pass covers you and any passengers with you in your private vehicle at unstaffed sites. At sites with a per-person fee, pass only covers pass holder, spouse, children and parents; other members of party are subject to fee. Pass is validated by printing clearly, in ink, the month, day and year you use it. Pass is valid until midnight of the day the buyer validates it. Northwest Forest Pass is non-transferable and non-refundable; REI members do not earn a dividend on the purchase of this pass.
short_description: The Northwest Forest Pass grants access to entrance or day-use fee sites on national forests in Washington and Oregon for a single day.
